definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: In the evening, the crestfallen little dog walked by a big tree.
sentences.chinese: 在晚上，小狗垂头丧气的在大树前乱动。

sentences.english: Sometimes we are happy and high-spirited. Sometimes we are in low spirits.
sentences.chinese: 有时兴高采烈，有时垂头丧气。

sentences.english: But God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us by the coming of Titus.
sentences.chinese: 但那安慰丧气之人的神，借着提多来安慰了我们。

sentences.english: Don’t get frustrated when your man tries to solve your problems.
sentences.chinese: 当你男人尝试解决你的问题时，别丧气。
你垂头丧气的。发生什么事了？
看看这只垂头丧气的秃鹰。

sentences.english: Come out for a walk instead of moping around in the house.
sentences.chinese: 别在房里垂头丧气地打转，出来散散步吧。

sentences.english: At night he would lie sleepless on his cot, suffering an almost unbearable frustration.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他躺在行军床上睡不着觉，灰心丧气难熬难挨。

sentences.english: Their spirits drooped as they watched their team lose.
sentences.chinese: 当他们看他们的球队输了时，他们感到丧气。

sentences.english: This, spoken in a cool, tranquil tone, was mortifying and baffling enough.
sentences.chinese: 这话说得沉着镇静，但也是够折磨人令人丧气的。

sentences.english: Poplar leaves is not reversed pendulum, and I never dejected life.
sentences.chinese: 白杨树没有倒垂的叶片，我也从没有垂头丧气的日子。

sentences.english: The naughty boy walked sadly to the headmaster's office.
sentences.chinese: 这个调皮的男孩子垂头丧气的朝校长办公室走去。

sentences.english: So upon that stricken multitude grim melancholy sat.
sentences.chinese: 所以，丧气的观众有著阴沈的忧伤。

sentences.english: Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;
sentences.chinese: 但那安慰丧气之人的神，借着提多来安慰了我们。

sentences.english: In a few minutes they were paddling sullenly back to the boat .
sentences.chinese: 过了一会，他们便垂头丧气地涉水回到小船上。
